segments.text: I see water pouring out of the sink, creating a puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's surprising that the woman hasn't noticed it yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is flowing over the edge of the sink, and it's only going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the dishes stacked on the counter, waiting to be dried.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman seems to be in her own world, focused on the plate she's drying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the water is going to cause a big mess, and she's going to be in for a shock.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window above the sink is open, letting in a peaceful view of the garden.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a nice day outside, but the woman is missing it, absorbed in her chores.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she'll slip on the wet floor and hurt herself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is already soaking into the cabinets, and it's only going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she needs to turn off the faucet as soon as possible.
segments.speaker: PAR
